# JSON.B64Encode

## Description:
This repository contains a python script that can be used to base 64 encode a JSON file with just one simple command.

## Pre-Requisites:
There are no pre-requisites to running this script. All of the included libraries are Python built-in librarires. No pip installs required.

## Arguments:
This script takes one single argument, being the file location of the JSON file that will be base64 encoded.

## File Checks:
This script is specifically written to handle JSON file objects. When the script is envoked and a proper file path is input, the script will validate that the file exists, it will then open the file and validate that the file is valid, properly formatted JSON. Once validated, the script will then base64 encode the JSON object and will output that base 64 value onto the screen.

## Script Execution:
```python3 b64encode.py /path/to/file.json```

bash-3.2$ python b64encode.py wordup-380014-1c70f875065f.json 

```bash
Processing File: file.json...
File path wordup-380014-1c70f875065f.json path validation... ✅
JSON validation... ✅
Base64 Encoding Contents Of: file.json...

b'
```
